events.body: utACK: read over non-test commits, looks reasonable.

The libbitcoinsonsensus header probably needs access access to SCRIPT_VERIFY_DERSIG now as well. Though it's not a network rule yet, I've already found it useful to use the lib to hack up quick DER checks.

ACK, other than the two issues mentioned above.

As nits, there are also a few places where comments should probably be updated regardless of what changes:
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/src/main.cpp#L1508
and
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/src/script/standard.h#L34

events.message: Add RPC test for DERSIG BIP switchover logic
Increase coverage of DERSIG edge cases

events.body: ACK. Code reviewed, tested by modifying bipdersig.py a couple of ways and making sure it failed when it should and didn't when it shouldn't.

utACK.
Did some test script manipulation and checked results. Looks good to me.
Re-ACK with issues now addressed. Thanks.

comments.body: Is this supposed to stay uncommented in the actual commit, or is it supposed to be re-commented once the updated JSON has been created?
FWIW, I also noticed this but since I didn't see the generated files in the git repository, I concluded it sense.

Woops, that uncommenting of the JSON test regeneration is unintentional.
On Jan 30, 2015 10:49 AM, "Luke-Jr" notifications@github.com wrote:

> In src/test/script_tests.cpp
> https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/5714#discussion_r23846306:
> 
> > @@ -40,7 +40,7 @@ using namespace json_spirit;
> >  using namespace boost::algorithm;
> > 
> >  // Uncomment if you want to output updated JSON tests.
> > -// #define UPDATE_JSON_TESTS
> > +#define UPDATE_JSON_TESTS
> 
> FWIW, I also noticed this but since I didn't see the generated files in
> the git repository, I concluded it sense.
>
